docTitle.titlePart: Mediating Semantic Web Service Access using the Semantic Firewall

byline.docAuthor:
E. Rowland Watkins, Steve J. Taylor,
Mike Surridge,

front.div:
Abstract
As the technical infrastructure to support Grid environments matures, attention should focus on providing dy-
namic access to services, whilst ensuring such access is appropriately monitored and secured. Access policies
may be dynamic, whereby intra-organisational workflows define local knowledge that could be used to establish
appropriate credentials necessary to access the desired service. We describe a typical Grid-based scenario that
requires local semantic workflows that establish the appropriate security access, whilst global workflows define
how external services are accessed. We present the Semantic Firewall, and the use of Process-based Access
Control (PBAC) to mediate service access, and present OWL-S extensions that support additional PBAC access
policies. Finally, a prototype implementation that validates this approach is presented.
